info.headline: Tornado Warning issued September 18 at 9:56PM CDT until September 18 at 10:45PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: The National Weather Service in St Louis has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northeastern Adams County in west central Illinois... * Until 1045 PM CDT. * At 956 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Mendon, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Weather spotters reported funnel cloud north of Lima in Hancock County. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Mendon around 1000 PM CDT. Golden around 1015 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this tornadic thunderstorm include Camp Point and Clayton. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
